content: I’m afraid I’m on the side of the authors here. I get what Google wanted to do, but I’m married to a midlist writer (over 30 novels in print) and am friends with many others, some best sellers. Absolutely zero of them wanted anyone to scan their copyrighted work and offer it online without any compensation to them. The people I know who keep proclaiming that “Information wants to be free” are also people who think they themselves should always be paid. But my favorite take on the subject is by Harlan Ellison: http://www.openculture.com/2015/11/harlan-ellisons-wonderful-rant-on-why-writers-should-always-get-paid.html
